speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: SCENE II. Southampton. A council-chamber.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Enter EXETER, BEDFORD, and WESTMORELAND

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: 'Fore God, his grace is bold, to trust these traitors.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: They shall be apprehended by and by.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: How smooth and even they do bear themselves!

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: As if allegiance in their bosoms sat,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Crowned with faith and constant loyalty.

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: The king hath note of all that they intend,

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: By interception which they dream not of.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Nay, but the man that was his bedfellow,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Whom he hath dull'd and cloy'd with gracious favours,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: That he should, for a foreign purse, so sell

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: His sovereign's life to death and treachery.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Trumpets sound. Enter KING HENRY V, SCROOP, CAMBRIDGE, GREY, and Attendants

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Now sits the wind fair, and we will aboard.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: My Lord of Cambridge, and my kind Lord of Masham,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And you, my gentle knight, give me your thoughts:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Think you not that the powers we bear with us

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Will cut their passage through the force of France,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Doing the execution and the act

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For which we have in head assembled them?

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: No doubt, my liege, if each man do his best.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I doubt not that; since we are well persuaded

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We carry not a heart with us from hence

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That grows not in a fair consent with ours,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Nor leave not one behind that doth not wish

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Success and conquest to attend on us.

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Never was monarch better fear'd and loved

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Than is your majesty: there's not, I think, a subject

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: That sits in heart-grief and uneasiness

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Under the sweet shade of your government.

speaker: GREY
text_entry: True: those that were your father's enemies

speaker: GREY
text_entry: Have steep'd their galls in honey and do serve you

speaker: GREY
text_entry: With hearts create of duty and of zeal.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We therefore have great cause of thankfulness;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And shall forget the office of our hand,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Sooner than quittance of desert and merit

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: According to the weight and worthiness.

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: So service shall with steeled sinews toil,

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: And labour shall refresh itself with hope,

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: To do your grace incessant services.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We judge no less. Uncle of Exeter,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enlarge the man committed yesterday,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That rail'd against our person: we consider

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: it was excess of wine that set him on;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And on his more advice we pardon him.

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: That's mercy, but too much security:

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: Let him be punish'd, sovereign, lest example

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: Breed, by his sufferance, more of such a kind.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: O, let us yet be merciful.

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: So may your highness, and yet punish too.

speaker: GREY
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: GREY
text_entry: You show great mercy, if you give him life,

speaker: GREY
text_entry: After the taste of much correction.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Alas, your too much love and care of me

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Are heavy orisons 'gainst this poor wretch!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If little faults, proceeding on distemper,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall not be wink'd at, how shall we stretch our eye

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: When capital crimes, chew'd, swallow'd and digested,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Appear before us? We'll yet enlarge that man,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Though Cambridge, Scroop and Grey, in their dear care

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And tender preservation of our person,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Would have him punished. And now to our French causes:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Who are the late commissioners?

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: I one, my lord:

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Your highness bade me ask for it to-day.

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: So did you me, my liege.

speaker: GREY
text_entry: And I, my royal sovereign.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Then, Richard Earl of Cambridge, there is yours;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: There yours, Lord Scroop of Masham; and, sir knight,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Grey of Northumberland, this same is yours:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Read them; and know, I know your worthiness.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: My Lord of Westmoreland, and uncle Exeter,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We will aboard to night. Why, how now, gentlemen!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What see you in those papers that you lose

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: So much complexion? Look ye, how they change!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Their cheeks are paper. Why, what read you there

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That hath so cowarded and chased your blood

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Out of appearance?

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: I do confess my fault;

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: And do submit me to your highness' mercy.

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: To which we all appeal.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The mercy that was quick in us but late,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: By your own counsel is suppress'd and kill'd:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: You must not dare, for shame, to talk of mercy;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For your own reasons turn into your bosoms,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: As dogs upon their masters, worrying you.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: See you, my princes, and my noble peers,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: These English monsters! My Lord of Cambridge here,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: You know how apt our love was to accord

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To furnish him with all appertinents

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Belonging to his honour; and this man

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Hath, for a few light crowns, lightly conspired,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And sworn unto the practises of France,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To kill us here in Hampton: to the which

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This knight, no less for bounty bound to us

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Than Cambridge is, hath likewise sworn. But, O,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What shall I say to thee, Lord Scroop? thou cruel,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Ingrateful, savage and inhuman creature!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Thou that didst bear the key of all my counsels,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That knew'st the very bottom of my soul,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That almost mightst have coin'd me into gold,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Wouldst thou have practised on me for thy use,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: May it be possible, that foreign hire

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Could out of thee extract one spark of evil

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That might annoy my finger? 'tis so strange,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That, though the truth of it stands off as gross

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: As black and white, my eye will scarcely see it.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Treason and murder ever kept together,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: As two yoke-devils sworn to either's purpose,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Working so grossly in a natural cause,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That admiration did not whoop at them:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But thou, 'gainst all proportion, didst bring in

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Wonder to wait on treason and on murder:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And whatsoever cunning fiend it was

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That wrought upon thee so preposterously

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Hath got the voice in hell for excellence:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: All other devils that suggest by treasons

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Do botch and bungle up damnation

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: With patches, colours, and with forms being fetch'd

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: From glistering semblances of piety;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But he that temper'd thee bade thee stand up,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Gave thee no instance why thou shouldst do treason,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Unless to dub thee with the name of traitor.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If that same demon that hath gull'd thee thus

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Should with his lion gait walk the whole world,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: He might return to vasty Tartar back,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And tell the legions 'I can never win

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: A soul so easy as that Englishman's.'

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: O, how hast thou with 'jealousy infected

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The sweetness of affiance! Show men dutiful?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Why, so didst thou: seem they grave and learned?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Why, so didst thou: come they of noble family?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Why, so didst thou: seem they religious?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Why, so didst thou: or are they spare in diet,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Free from gross passion or of mirth or anger,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Constant in spirit, not swerving with the blood,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Garnish'd and deck'd in modest complement,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Not working with the eye without the ear,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And but in purged judgment trusting neither?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Such and so finely bolted didst thou seem:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And thus thy fall hath left a kind of blot,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To mark the full-fraught man and best indued

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: With some suspicion. I will weep for thee;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For this revolt of thine, methinks, is like

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Another fall of man. Their faults are open:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Arrest them to the answer of the law;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And God acquit them of their practises!

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Richard Earl of Cambridge.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Henry Lord Scroop of Masham.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Thomas Grey, knight, of Northumberland.

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: Our purposes God justly hath discover'd;

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: And I repent my fault more than my death;

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: Which I beseech your highness to forgive,

speaker: SCROOP
text_entry: Although my body pay the price of it.

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: For me, the gold of France did not seduce;

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Although I did admit it as a motive

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: The sooner to effect what I intended:

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: But God be thanked for prevention;

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Which I in sufferance heartily will rejoice,

speaker: CAMBRIDGE
text_entry: Beseeching God and you to pardon me.

speaker: GREY
text_entry: Never did faithful subject more rejoice

speaker: GREY
text_entry: At the discovery of most dangerous treason

speaker: GREY
text_entry: Than I do at this hour joy o'er myself.

speaker: GREY
text_entry: Prevented from a damned enterprise:

speaker: GREY
text_entry: My fault, but not my body, pardon, sovereign.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: God quit you in his mercy! Hear your sentence.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: You have conspired against our royal person,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Join'd with an enemy proclaim'd and from his coffers

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Received the golden earnest of our death;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Wherein you would have sold your king to slaughter,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: His princes and his peers to servitude,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: His subjects to oppression and contempt

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And his whole kingdom into desolation.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Touching our person seek we no revenge;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But we our kingdom's safety must so tender,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Whose ruin you have sought, that to her laws

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We do deliver you. Get you therefore hence,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Poor miserable wretches, to your death:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The taste whereof, God of his mercy give

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: You patience to endure, and true repentance

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Of all your dear offences! Bear them hence.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Exeunt CAMBRIDGE, SCROOP and GREY, guarded

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Now, lords, for France; the enterprise whereof

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall be to you, as us, like glorious.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We doubt not of a fair and lucky war,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Since God so graciously hath brought to light

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This dangerous treason lurking in our way

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To hinder our beginnings. We doubt not now

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But every rub is smoothed on our way.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Then forth, dear countrymen: let us deliver

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Our puissance into the hand of God,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Putting it straight in expedition.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Cheerly to sea; the signs of war advance:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: No king of England, if not king of France.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Exeunt
